data.title: LSI Expands Networking Ecosystem to Accelerate Implementation of 4G Networks
data.meta_description: /PRNewswire/ -- LSI Corporation (NYSE: LSI) today announced enhanced ecosystem support for its Axxia® platform that accelerates time to market and lowers...
data.text:
MILPITAS, Calif., Feb. 24, 2012 /PRNewswire/ -- LSI Corporation (NYSE: LSI) today announced enhanced ecosystem support for its Axxia® platform that accelerates time to market and lowers software investment for mobile equipment manufacturers. LSI and its growing base of ecosystem partners provide hardware and software solutions for 4G wireless base stations designed to help networking manufacturers and service providers contend with massive mobile broadband data usage growth. LSI is working with the lead partner in the Axxia mobile ecosystem, Radisys, to integrate and optimize its Trillium 3G and 4G wireless protocol software for the LSI® Axxia platform.

(Logo: http://photos.prnewswire.com/prnh/20120222/SF57952LOGO)

This expansion of the LSI networking ecosystem will:

Allow wireless manufacturers to more quickly bring solutions to market while minimizing product development costs

Provide a consistent software framework that allows seamless migration across the Axxia family, allowing solutions to scale from small cells to super macro base stations

Embed intelligence in base stations and wireless infrastructure to identify traffic and deliver the right data at the right time

"We established the LSI networking ecosystem several years ago in anticipation of service providers' need for robust, combined solutions as they race to deploy 4G wireless infrastructure solutions," said Noy Kucuk, vice president of marketing, Networking Components Division, LSI. "The mobile ecosystem provides a suite of tools and solutions that work together to speed time to market and deliver the performance and power benefits of the Axxia family."

The mobile platform framework maximizes software reuse and enables customers to optimize their investment choices by focusing their scarce resources on highly differentiated solution development. Customers benefit from the ability to simply deploy solutions from ecosystem members. LSI and ecosystem partners work together to pre-integrate solutions and drive interoperability.

"Leveraging software investments from small cells to macro base stations will help speed the adoption of 4G networks at lower costs for our customers," said Amit Agarwal, vice president and general manager of software and solutions, Radisys. "By combining the LSI Axxia platform with our optimized Trillium wireless software, wireless OEMs can tackle the scalability issues of all types of mobile infrastructure."

The Axxia platform combines the programmable flexibility of general-purpose processors with the deterministic performance of special-purpose accelerators from LSI to provide scalable and customizable solutions for mobile infrastructure. Based on a coherent multiprocessor interconnect and LSI Virtual Pipeline™ technology, Axxia processors can be tailored to unique OEM requirements.

Information on the LSI mobile ecosystem and networking portfolio will be available at the LSI hospitality suite AV76 at the GSMA Mobile World Congress in Barcelona, Spain, February 27 to March 1. The LSI stand is located midway along the Avenue near the crosswalk between the Courtyard and Hall 8 of the exhibition.

For more information on LSI and the company's products, visit www.lsi.com. For information on the LSI ecosystem, visit http://www.lsi.com/partners/Pages/technology.aspx.

Supporting Statements from Ecosystem Partners

Hakan Rippe, Senior Vice President, ENEA

"The LSI Axxia family of products has been widely adopted in wireless infrastructure. We look forward to working closely with LSI to strengthen the wireless platform ecosystem and offer our proven capabilities to integrate complex hardware and software platforms combined with LSI's validated, scalable and versatile software platform."

Glenn Perry, General Manager of Embedded Software Division, Mentor Graphics

"We see LSI's family of products as an excellent platform to leverage Mentor's embedded expertise and leadership in optimized open source products and services. The addition of ARM CPUs to the Axxia platform provides a significant industry advantage and we believe our collaboration with LSI will accelerate the deployment of these advanced technologies."

Russ Garcia, Executive Vice President and General Manager, Communications and Medical Products, Microsemi

"A strong ecosystem comprised of industry-leading suppliers allows manufacturers to efficiently, quickly and economically develop complex network infrastructure equipment. We are pleased to be a member of LSI's Axxia Wireless Ecosystem, and apply our expertise in timing and synchronization solutions to enable the rapid growth of 4G/LTE networks."

Mike Langlois, Vice President and General Manager, Networking and Telecommunications, Wind River

"Our ongoing relationship with LSI and their approach to integrating components and a host of power-saving features into the Axxia family of processors will help meet our customers' demands for lower system power requirements and greater reliability while providing a scalable software solution."

About LSI

LSI Corporation (NYSE: LSI) designs semiconductors and software that accelerate storage and networking in datacenters and mobile networks. Our technology is the intelligence critical to enhanced application performance, and is applied in solutions created in collaboration with our partners. More information is available at www.lsi.com.
